paragraphs.text:
%md
## Selecting a wine to bring that is likley to be good and is inexpensive!
### We've all been there.   We are invited to a party and want to bring something to contribute.   A bottle of wine is always a good option.   But which one?   There are so many!   And we don't want to break the bank for our party gift.   Let's try to use the Autonomous Database and Oracle Machine Learning to find a likely tasty and likley to be rated greater than 90 Points (GT_90_Points) adult beverage that is also affordable (Under $35).  
##### Original data comes from Kaggle WineReviews130K data = 130k wine reviews with variety, location, winery, price, and description etc.   Wine Reviews and Twitter Handle were removed.   Points was binned to GT_90 and LT_90 <https://www.kaggle.com/zynicide/wine-reviews>  

### Steps
#### 1. Explore the data
#### 2. Define the Target Attribute (GT_90_Points vs. LT_90_Points)
#### 3. Find the Key Attributes that Most Influence GT_90_Points_Bin)
#### 4. Build a Machine Learning Model to Predict Good Wines to Buy
#### 5. Save our results and further investigage our wine findings using the Oracle Analytics Cloud

Updated August 2019 By: Charlie Berger, Dhvani Sheth, Siddesh Ujjni

msg.data:
Selecting a wine to bring that is likley to be good and is inexpensive!

We've all been there. We are invited to a party and want to bring something to contribute. A bottle of wine is always a good option. But which one? There are so many! And we don't want to break the bank for our party gift. Let's try to use the Autonomous Database and Oracle Machine Learning to find a likely tasty and likley to be rated greater than 90 Points (GT_90_Points) adult beverage that is also affordable (Under $35).

Original data comes from Kaggle WineReviews130K data = 130k wine reviews with variety, location, winery, price, and description etc. Wine Reviews and Twitter Handle were removed. Points was binned to GT_90 and LT_90 https://www.kaggle.com/zynicide/wine-reviews

Steps

1. Explore the data

2. Define the Target Attribute (GT_90_Points vs. LT_90_Points)

3. Find the Key Attributes that Most Influence GT_90_Points_Bin)

4. Build a Machine Learning Model to Predict Good Wines to Buy

5. Save our results and further investigage our wine findings using the Oracle Analytics Cloud

Updated August 2019 By: Charlie Berger, Dhvani Sheth, Siddesh Ujjni

paragraphs.title: Preparatory Steps for Attribute Importance for Repeatability

msg.data:
DROP TABLE Att_Import_Mode_Settings PURGE: succeeded
CALL DBMS_DATA_MINING.DROP_MODEL('GOOD_WINE__AI'): succeeded


PL/SQL procedure successfully completed.

paragraphs.title: Define Attribute Importance Model Settings
paragraphs.text:
%script

CREATE TABLE Att_Import_Mode_Settings ( 
  setting_name  VARCHAR2(30), 
  setting_value VARCHAR2(30));

msg.data:
Table ATT_IMPORT_MODE_SETTINGS created.


---------------------------

paragraphs.title: Build Attribute Importance Model (Supervised Learning Machine Learning Model using Minimum Description Length Algorithm)
paragraphs.text:
%script

BEGIN
   DBMS_DATA_MINING.CREATE_MODEL(
     model_name 	  	    => 'GOOD_WINE__AI',
     mining_function		=> DBMS_DATA_MINING.ATTRIBUTE_IMPORTANCE,
     data_table_name		=> 'WineReviews130KTarget',
     case_id_column_name 	=> 'ID',
     target_column_name	    => 'POINTS_BIN',
     settings_table_name 	=> 'Att_Import_Mode_Settings');
END;
/

msg.data:
PL/SQL procedure successfully completed.


---------------------------

Medium to full in body, this has structured tannins, with flavors that fade on the midpalate but resurface again on the brisk finish.
108683	GT_90_POINTS	0.8196165525117272	0.18038344748827284	108683	Austria	Anninger	GT_90_Points	19	Thermenregion			Anne Krebiehl MW	Zierfandler	Stadlmann 2014 Anninger Zierfandler (Thermenregion)	Very faint peach notes break through the lemony freshness of this slender, golden wine. The usually richer, more sumptuous nature of Zierfandler shines through on the textured palate and in the glimpses of generous oiliness that flank the edges of the central citrus focus. This is lovely now but will reward cellaring. The finish is poised and clean-cut, lemony and long.
48922	GT_90_POINTS	0.0339002060856253	0.9660997939143747	48922	Spain	Crianza	LT_90_Points	35	Northern Spain	Ribera del Duero		Michael Schachner	Tempranillo	Portia 2009 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)	Chunky, ripe black-fruit aromas come with violet accents. The mouthfeel is good but gritty, with hard tannins and a lot of oak that creates a buttery topping to plum, cassis and molasses flavors. This ripe wine finishes stable but quick, with some chocolate flavor but not much else.
38736	GT_90_POINTS	0.5490407363340731	0.45095926366592687	38736	US		GT_90_Points	26	Washington	Columbia Valley (WA)	Columbia Valley	Sean P. Sullivan	Cabernet Sauvignon	Novelty Hill 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))	Cocoa powder, vanilla, toast and high-toned blue and black-fruit flavors are followed by a flavorful fruit-forward palate. It doesn't always seem entirely varietal but still brings plenty of appeal.

paragraphs.title: Show 1,000 Wines that are less than $15 and their predicted Points (looking for really inexpensive GT_90_Points wines)
paragraphs.text:
%sql
SELECT ID, Price, Country, Designation, Province, Variety, prediction, probability
  FROM (SELECT ID, Price, Country, Designation, Province, Variety,
               PREDICTION_SET(Wine_CLASS_MODEL USING *) pset
          FROM WineReviews130KTarget
         WHERE ID < 1000 and Price <15) T,
       TABLE(pset) S
ORDER BY prediction, probability desc, ID;

%md
### See how easy machine learning can be inside the Oracle Autonomous Database?   Celebrate with a fine glass of wine!
### Let's now investigate our wine insights and predictions a bit further using Oracle APEX and/or Oracle Analytics Cloud!

msg.data:
See how easy machine learning can be inside the Oracle Autonomous Database? Celebrate with a fine glass of wine!

Let's now investigate our wine insights and predictions a bit further using Oracle APEX and/or Oracle Analytics Cloud!

paragraphs.title: For Running this Notebook Again, Remove Any Previous WinePredictons Table

msg.data:
DROP TABLE WinePredictons PURGE: succeeded


PL/SQL procedure successfully completed.

paragraphs.title: Create WinePredictions table in ADW for Access by Oracle APEX and Analytics Cloud
paragraphs.text:
%script
-- Create table WinePredictons for viewing in Oracle Analytics Cloud


Create table WinePredictons as 
  SELECT ID, Price, Country, Winery, Region_1, Designation, Province, Variety, prediction, probability
  FROM (SELECT ID, Price, Country, Winery, Region_1, Designation, Province, Variety,
               PREDICTION_SET(Wine_CLASS_MODEL USING *) pset
          FROM WineReviews130KTarget
         WHERE ID < 100000 and Price < 500) T,
       TABLE(pset) S
ORDER BY prediction, probability desc, ID;

msg.data:
Table WINEPREDICTONS created.


---------------------------
